Title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities were found in OpenSSL, the worst of which
    could allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1/v1.1/v1.2/v1.3) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text:
A remote attacker could perform a malicious crafted TLS 1.3 handshake against an application using OpenSSL, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

In addition, itâ€™s feasible that an attacker might attack DH512.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenSSL users should upgrade to the latest version:
